name: Laboratory Findings
description: Laboratory test findings including, but is not limited to hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis data. This domain does not include microbiology or pharmacokinetic data, which are stored in separate domains.
structure: One record per lab test per time point per visit per subject, Tabulation

variables.name: LBTESTCD
variables.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name
variables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g.”1TEST”). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: ALT, LDH.

variables.name: LBTEST
variables.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
variables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Alanine Aminotransferase, Lactate Dehydrogenase.

variables.name: LBORRES
variables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
variables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

variables.name: LBORRESU
variables.label: Original Units
variables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for LBORRES. Example: g/L.
